video.description:
Chimichurri Sweet Potato Black Bean Quesadilla â€“ 10 minutes! 
ðŸ’™ FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/06/chimichurri-sweet-potato-black-bean-quesadilla-10-minute.html
ðŸ’™ MY COOKBOOKS: https://veganricha.com/mybooks

This Grilled Quesadillas with Spiced Black Beans. Roasted Sweet Potatoes, Peppers and a refreshing Chimichurri sauce, is quick, summery, and great for school lunches. Easily GF with a Glutenfree tortilla. 

Use cooked beans of choice such as black, kidney or pinto, some crunchy or roasted peppers or veggies and sweet potatoes and grill it all up with the made from scratch chimichurri sauce and optional vegan cheese. My Creamy Cashew garlic sauce also works as a cheese sub. It thickens and sticks to make a cheesy addition that holds the veggies together. 
Vegan Nutfree Soyfree Recipe. Can be Gluten-free.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup packed parsley (, or one bunch parsley leaves and tender stems, chopped)
1/4 cup basil (packed, or use cilantro)
6 to 8 cloves of raw garlic (, more the merrier)
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
juice of 1 lime
1 tsp vinegar apple cider or balsamic or red wine vinegar
1/2 tsp dried oregano
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper
2 tbsp or more avocado for creamyness (optional)
15 oz can Black beans (drained or 1.5 cups cooked, or use other cooked beans of choice)
1/2 cup corn (, boiled for a few mins if needed, then drained)
1.5 cups cubed (cooked) sweet potato, boiled or baked
1/2 cup chopped onion
1  jalapeno or 1/4 bell pepper finely chopped
salt and cumin to taste
a generous dash of black pepper
1 tsp or more chili powder blend or taco spice blend to taste
Vegan Cheese Slices such as Chao
Or Vegan mozzarella slices from Everyday Kitchen Book
4  tortillas ((gluten free if needed))

recipeInstructions.text: Blend all the ingredients under chimichurri with a few tbsp of water until just about smooth. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add a pinch of sweetener to balance if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend all the ingredients under chimichurri with a few tbsp of water until just about smooth. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add a pinch of sweetener to balance if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix black beans, corn, pepper, roasted sweet potato and the spices in a bowl. Add some of the chimichurri to coat. (You can cook this mix a bit on a skillet to intensify the flavors at this point before using in the quesadilla or sandwich).
recipeInstructions.name: Mix black beans, corn, pepper, roasted sweet potato and the spices in a bowl. Add some of the chimichurri to coat. (You can cook this mix a bit on a skillet to intensify the flavors at this point before using in the quesadilla or sandwich).

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the mixture on one half of larger tortillas, add sliced cheese, fold over and grill until melted. Or use the whole tortilla and place on a pan over medium heat. add the filling, cheese, place another tortilla on top and cook over medium heat pressing occasionally.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the mixture on one half of larger tortillas, add sliced cheese, fold over and grill until melted. Or use the whole tortilla and place on a pan over medium heat. add the filling, cheese, place another tortilla on top and cook over medium heat pressing occasionally.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice and Serve with more chimichurri or some salsa or guacamole.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice and Serve with more chimichurri or some salsa or guacamole.
